additional driversinstallingstagesinstalling additional driversTo install additional drivers for a stage, perform the following steps:
Create a local directory external to the installation directory for the drivers. Use an external directory to enable use of the drivers after upgrading the .
For example, if you installed the in the following directory: /opt/sdc/
you might create the driver directory at: /opt/sdc-extras
Copy the drivers to the directory. Use a directory structure for each set of drivers based on the stage library name and directory structure as follows:
<stage library name>/lib/<driver name>
For example to install drivers for JMS in an opt/sdc-extras directory, you would copy them to the following directory: /opt/sdc-extras/streamsets-datacollector-jms-lib/lib/
In the environment file, sdc-env.sh or sdcd-env.sh, add the STREAMSETS_LIBRARIES_EXTRA_DIR environment variable and point it to the driver directory, as follows:export STREAMSETS_LIBRARIES_EXTRA_DIR = <driver directory>
For example: export STREAMSETS_LIBRARIES_EXTRA_DIR = /opt/sdc-extras/
When using the Java Security Manager, which is enabled by default, update the security policy to include the driver directory as follows:
In the configuration directory, edit the security policy:<SDCinstalldir>/etc/sdc-security.policy
Add the following lines to the file: // user-defined additional driver directory grant codebase "file://<driver directory>-" { permission java.security.AllPermission; };
For example: // user-defined additional driver directory grant codebase "file:///opt/sdc-extras/-" { permission java.security.AllPermission; };
Restart the .
The drivers in the directory become available to their respective stages.
